1.comment: Steven Jackson ran for 53 yards on just 13 carries. And

2.comment: Steven Jackson had a decent game. He didn't get into the end zone, but he had 128 total yards (66 rushing, 62 receiving).

3.comment: Steven Jackson kept St. Louis in the game until the beginning of the 4.h quarter. Jackson rushed for 110 yards and a touchdown on 24 carries. He also had 5 receptions for 78 yards. Give credit to Buffalo's defense though. After gaining 99 yards on 16 carries in the first half, Jackson managed only 11 yards on 8 attempts in the final 30 minutes. That allowed the Bills to overcome an odd 14-6 deficit and establish control of the game.    It also shocked me that

4.comment: Steven Jackson in the second quarter.    The Rams had the last laugh though, somehow pulling the upset on the road despite the fact that Washington was the largest favorite this week. St. Louis' 19-17 victory was very inexplicable, especially considering that the team failed to score an offensive touchdown. The only time the Rams reached the end zone was on a 75-yard

5.comment: Steven Jackson did all the damage, rushing for 160 yards on 25 attempts. Jackson found the end zone 3 times.    One last thing: All everyone is going to talk about is how Dallas didn't show up - and I guess I'm guilty of that too - but the Rams are now 2-0 under Jim Haslett. Haslett was abysmal in New Orleans, but he's doing a terrific job with his new team. If this keeps up, St. Louis needs to make him its permanent head coach.

6.comment: Steven Jackson also had fantasy owners and Rams backers crying in despair. Jackson carried the ball only 7 times, gaining just 17 yards.

7.comment: Steven Jackson. Going into this game, it was unclear if Jackson would even play. He looked close to 100 percent, rushing for 94 yards and catching a 16-yard pass. Jackson helped St. Louis win the time-of-possession battle, and allowed the team to convert 7-of-14 third downs. As a comparison, the Dolphins were 4-of-12 on third down.    Unfortunately for the Rams,

8.comment: Steven Jackson rushed for just 64 yards on 19 carries. He also fumbled the ball away twice. I was expecting more from Jackson, who was playing in his second week back from his quad injury.    Arizona's passing offense didn't disappoint. Successfully rebounding off a tough performance,

9.comment: Steven Jackson rushed for 108 yards on 32 carries.

10.comment: Steven Jackson rushed for 161 yards and 2 touchdowns. And

12.comment: Steven Jackson, who rushed for 117 yards on 27 attempts. Jackson also led the team in receptions (5 for 46 yards). It's amazing that Jackson can still be productive with the crap around him.    It was another poor game for

13.comment: Steven Jackson; Jackson managed 79 yards, but it took him 23 carries to get there. Of course the 49ers were able to stack the run because

14.comment: Steven Jackson fumbled on the Minnesota 2, and Daniel Fells later fumbled inside the 5.

15.comment: Steven Jackson was the only St. Louis player who did anything. Jackson had just 50 rushing yards on 16 carries, but he also notched 6 receptions for 78 more yards.

16.comment: Steven Jackson, once again, was the only Rams offensive player worth mentioning. He rushed for 134 yards on 23 attempts. It's really a shame that his talent is going to waste like this. I've said it a few times and I'll say it again: If I'm the Rams, I sit Jackson for the rest of the year so he's healthy and fresh next season when the team will be more competitive. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

17.comment: Steven Jackson, who has playing hard all year despite all of these losses. Jackson rushed for 149 yards on 22 carries. He also scored his first touchdown of the year.

18.comment: Steven Jackson once again was amazing. He rushed for 131 yards and a touchdown on 26 carries. He also caught a whopping 9 balls for 45 yards. It's clear that the Saints really miss stud defensive tackle Sedrick Ellis. They'll continue to struggle versus the run until he returns.    While the Rams played well throughout this contest, their final 2-minute drive was very amusing. Bulger was horrible, hitting Saints defenders in the back, throwing short passes over the middle with no timeouts and wasting tons of time in other situations. Bulger basically had to go 80 yards with 2:21 in regulation and no timeouts. Despite that dilemma, Bulger had completions of just 7, 6, 9, 11, 4 and 5 yards. Not exactly what you're looking for when you need a very quick score. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

19.comment: Steven Jackson performance. Jackson rumbled for 116 yards and a touchdown on 24 carries. He didn't do anything in terms of catching the ball out of the backfield.

20.comment: Steven Jackson once again carried the Rams, rushing for 89 yards and a touchdown on 23 carries. Not bad for a guy who was a game-time decision going into the contest.    Neither

21.comment: Steven Jackson continued to run hard despite his back spasms, compiling 112 yards on 28 carries.    As you can imagine, Kyle Boller was pretty pedestrian; he was 17-of-32 for just 113 yards and an interception.

22.comment: Steven Jackson to 47 yards on 19 carries. The Rams should consider shutting Jackson down for the rest of the year to avoid further injury to him.    All right, enough about those crappy Rams. The most important story regarding this game was

23.comment: Steven Jackson coming out of the backfield.    And speaking of Jackson, he rushed for 82 yards on 20 carries despite back spasms, a herniated disc in his back and the flu. Jackson also paced the team in receiving with 41 yards.

24.comment: Steven Jackson, mustered just 63 yards on 20 tries. I can't find a reason why a hobbled Jackson should have played. There was really no point in risking his health even further. Not sure what Steve Spagnuolo was thinking here.

25.comment: Steven Jackson looked great, rushing for 81 yards on 22 carries. Like last year though, Jackson couldn't find the end zone because the offense didn't give him the opportunity. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

26.comment: Steven Jackson kept the Rams in the game, totaling 75 rushing yards on 19 carries and 50 receiving yards off 4 catches. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

27.comment: Steven Jackson notched 58 yards and a touchdown on 10 carries, while Kenneth Darby registered 49 yards and a score on 14 attempts.

28.comment: Steven Jackson was a game-time decision going into this NFC West battle. He looked pretty good against a stout Seattle run defense, totaling 70 yards on 22 carries. He also had 3 catches for 54 receiving yards.    The Seahawks just can't win on the road. Glue factory quarterback

29.comment: Steven Jackson ran really well, gaining 114 yards on 25 attempts. Once again, he couldn't find the end zone playing in a stagnant offense.

30.comment: Steven Jackson for becoming the franchise's all-time leading rusher. Jackson rushed for 110 yards on 22 carries, and really helped an otherwise stagnant St. Louis offense.

31.comment: Steven Jackson struggled to find running room, gaining 59 yards on 23 carries. But it's not like Jackson looked terrible or anything; he had a few impressive runs.    Carolina fans, meanwhile, really have to be depressed. Not because they lost this game; but because owner Jerry Richardson is too cheap to fire John Fox, who has no interest in the team's future. Fox continues to use

32.comment: Steven Jackson was awesome; he rushed for 81 yards and a score, and caught a whopping 8 passes for 67 receiving yards.    The Rams tallied 5 sacks in this game. They now lead the NFL with 28.

33.comment: Steven Jackson struggle to run the ball (29-72) against Denver's rush defense, which was ranked 24th coming into this week.

34.comment: Steven Jackson fumbled in the first quarter. At that point, the Saints were up 7-0. The Rams were driving, but Jackson (16-96) coughed it up at midfield. Minutes later,

35.comment: Steven Jackson (19-67, TD) and Danny Amendola (7-60).

36.comment: Steven Jackson had only 15 touches. There's no reasonable explanation for this. The Rams also looked confused and disoriented as a whole throughout most of the night - especially at the end of the game when Spagnuolo mismanaged his challenges and timeouts. D) The officials: Surprise, surprise. Jerome Boger screwed up yet another game. Check out these blown calls that went in Seattle's favor: 1. A shady holding call which gave the Seahawks a touchdown instead of a field goal on the opening drive. 2. A missed offsides penalty that was so obvious that

37.comment: Steven Jackson pulled his quad on 47-yard touchdown run early in the first quarter. Jackson had another 9-yard run, but then had to leave the game. A pulled quad doesn't sound serious, but soft-tissue injuries 10. to linger. Later in the game,

38.comment: Steven Jackson; 4 carries, 23 yards), Sam Bradford didn't have a prayer of leading his team to victory.

39.comment: Steven Jackson was the only Ram to carry the football. The Redskins bottled him up well, limiting him to 45 yards on 17 carries.

40.comment: Steven Jackson rushed for 70 yards and a touchdown on 18 carries, though he was inexplicably on the field during the final seconds. Steve Spagnuolo is very fortunate Jackson didn't get hurt. Meanwhile,

41.comment: Steven Jackson, who rumbled for 159 yards and 2 touchdowns on 25 carries. Jackson also chipped in with 4 catches for 32 receiving yards.    Jackson's running made life especially easy for Adam Joshua Feeley, who went 20-of-37 for 175 yards and a score to

42.comment: Steven Jackson running well, St. Louis should have blown out this miserable Cardinal squad that was playing without its backup quarterback. Instead, they lost, and Bradford didn't look much better than Adam Joshua Feeley did the past 2 weeks; the second-year signal-caller had several overthrows in this contest. Bradford finished 23-of-36 for 255 yards and an interception. He showed an OK rapport with

43.comment: Steven Jackson lost a fumble at the 30-yard line on what would have been a first down. Cleveland's error, meanwhile, was much more costly. The Browns drove down to St. Louis' 4-yard line as time was ticking down. A chip-shot field goal would have won the game, but

44.comment: Steven Jackson rushed for only 42 yards on 15 carries against Seattle's top-five rush defense - Bradford just had major difficulty moving the chains the entire afternoon. The Rams had just 185 total yards of offense.

45.comment: Steven Jackson had lots of work early on, but didn't have much luck running the football, mustering 64 yards on 17 attempts. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

46.comment: Steven Jackson and former 49er Brandon Lloyd on an acrobatic play, it looked like they might do something. Then Dashaun Goldson intercepted Feeley on an awful throw. San Francisco's offense decided to get creative on this series, handing the ball off to a wide receiver (Ted Ginn Jr.) and pitching to a tight end (Delanie Walker) for 2 quick first downs. Then Alex Smith dropped a 52-yard bomb to Crabtree for a touchdown and the 16-0 lead. If St. Louis had any hope, it was extinguished right there. San Francisco overcame a penalty to open their next drive and ended up with a field goal to extend its advantage, leaving it 19-0 at the end of the third quarter. At the start of the 4.h quarter, Alex Smith hit Kyle Williams who did all the work for a 56-yard touchdown to make the final margin 26-0. It was another ho-hum day for Smith (17-of-23, 274 yards, 2 TDs), although he was sacked 4 times. Gore was contained (21 rushes for 73 yards) and a lot of the rushing yardage for San Francisco came on gimmick plays to receiving threats who picked up 55 yards on 3 attempts. Most importantly, the 49ers did not turn the ball over and played smothering defense. The Rams' running back Steven Jackson and his backup, Jerious Norwood, each had just 19 yards rushing on a combined 21 attempts for a 1.

47.comment: Steven Jackson, but lost an opportunity to pin Cincinnati when punter Donnie Jones put the ball in the end zone.

48.comment: Steven Jackson, but lost an opportunity to pin Cincinnati when punter Donnie Jones put the ball in the end zone.

49.comment: Steven Jackson ran well (24-103), so it's a shame that another good effort of his was wasted. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

50.comment: Steven Jackson (16-76) picked up 20 yards on 3 straight carries to put St. Louis in the red zone. Two plays later, the Rams were forced to third down, and with Clemens scrambling out of trouble, it looked like a field goal attempt was coming due. That is, until he kept running towards the end zone for the 7-0 lead and rare rushing score against this 49ers' defense. Both offenses followed with 3.and-outs, but the field position exchange went heavily in favor of San Francisco, which got a huge 66-yard punt out of

51.comment: Steven Jackson compiled about a third of the Rams' offense despite the fact that he couldn't find much running room. He gained just 53 yards on 21 carries and also chipped in with 4 catches for 31 more yards.

52.comment: Steven Jackson rushing touchdown on third down. It was an obvious score, and everyone knew it. They took forever to make the call, angering Jackson, who spiked the ball in anger. The officials whistled him for a personal-foul penalty. Making matters worse, they didn't give him the score, and they didn't let Jeff Fisher challenge for some strange reason. It was so bizarre, and Roger Goodell needs to be embarrassed that he's allowing these shenanigans to continue. - The Rams ran a promotion called Jeff Fisher Mustache Day, where they handed out fake mustaches to the 50 people who went to the game. Fisher was asked about this, but responded, Can we talk about football, please?    Despite all of the ineptness, both quarterbacks played really well.

53.comment: Steven Jackson gained only 29 yards on 11 carries. He was on and off the field because of his knee injury. In fact, it looked like he would be pulled after 3 carries. He stood on the sideline with an enormous ice pack on his knee, but he reentered the contest. You have to admire Jackson's courage to play through pain, but it was really a stupid idea. Jackson should have taken the time to heal; instead, his football arrogance hurt his team because it kept a healthy

54.comment: Steven Jackson had a pretty solid outing despite his mediocre statistics. He rushed for just 55 yards on 18 attempts, but he did a good job on some tough runs versus Seattle's stout ground defense.    Meanwhile,

55.comment: Steven Jackson (12-52) and Daryl Richardson (11-76) ran the ball so well against a Miami rush defense that was ranked No.

56.comment: Steven Jackson (12-57, TD) and Daryl Richardson (8-36) were both effective in the first half, but as mentioned, couldn't do much after intermission because their team was facing a big deficit.

57.comment: Steven Jackson and Daryl Richardson split touches.

58.comment: Steven Jackson handled the majority of the workload.

59.comment: Steven Jackson once again handled most of the workload, rushing for 139 yards on 24 carries.    As for Arizona's ground attack, Chris Wells scored twice, but was otherwise pretty pedestrian. He gained 48 yards on 17 carries.    Speaking of pedestrian, Larry Fitzgerald's numbers were once again awful; he caught 3 balls for 31 yards. He's dealing with bracket coverage, and the Cardinals just don't have the quarterback to deliver the football to him. Lindley spent most of the time throwing to

60.comment: Steven Jackson's presence was also huge. He managed just 48 yards on 21 attempts, but he was a strong option for Bradford out of the backfield, catching 5 passes for 69 receiving yards. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

61.comment: Steven Jackson had an OK outing, gaining 64 yards and a touchdown on 19 carries. Buffalo's defense has improved against the rush since the bye, so this was a good effort from Jackson.    As for the Bills, Chan Gailey deserves to be fired for this latest defeat. His best player,

62.comment: Steven Jackson had a nice outing overall, rushing for 73 yards on 13 carries and also catching 8 balls for 73 receiving yards. He simply couldn't get enough work on the ground because the team was down big early, but he made up for it with his receiving numbers. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

63.comment: Steven Jackson (19-81) touchdown run.  - A few plays after St. Louis' touchdown that opened the third quarter, Freeman dialed up the Rams up for points with an interception to

64.comment: Steven Jackson has discussed retirement, so this may have been his final game. He nearly totaled 100 yards, rushing for 52 yards on 11 carries and catching 7 balls for 45 receiving yards.    No Ram had more than 54 receiving yards (

65.comment: Steven Jackson had just 11 carries for 77 yards, including a 50-yard scamper. Atlanta never trailed by more than 6 points, so I'm not sure why the team abandoned its rushing attack, especially since Jackson was such a prized offseason acquisition. It's worth noting though that Jackson dropped 2 passes, including a key 1 on the team's final drive.

67.comment: Steven Jackson suffered a thigh injury in the first quarter. The Falcons listed him as questionable to return, but he never took the field again. All he was able to do was catch an 8.yard touchdown and carry the ball 3 times for no yards. Despite missing 2 key weapons,

68.comment: Steven Jackson managed to gain 57 yards on 13 carries to go along with 3 catches for 19 receiving yards. He also appeared to score a touchdown, but that was wiped out by a

69.comment: Steven Jackson seemed to have a good matchup because Seattle's run defense has been leaky lately. Red Bryant being out only made it seem more lucrative. However, Jackson struggled yet again, mustering only 11 yards on 9 carries.    Ryan's leading receiver was

70.comment: Steven Jackson had 41 yards rushing and 24 yards receiving.    Defensively, Tampa Bay got a great game from

71.comment: Steven Jackson rushed for 37 yards and a touchdown on just 9 carries in the opening half, but had a meager 7-26 line following intermission.    As for

72.comment: Steven Jackson showed some rare life against the Bills. He still looked a bit slow, but he pummeled his way for 84 yards and 2 touchdown on 23 carries. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

73.comment: Steven Jackson, who found some room on the ground; he gained 71 yards on 15 carries.

74.comment: Steven Jackson appeared to be on his way to a big day early on when he had an impressive run in which he dragged multiple defenders. He managed to score twice, but accumulated just 38 yards on 15 carries. He was stuffed at the goal line in the second half and dropped a pass in the red zone. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

75.comment: Steven Jackson (13-41 rushing, 5-53 receiving) and Harry Douglas (7-58) chipped in.

76.comment: Steven Jackson (13-41 rushing, 5-53 receiving) and Harry Douglas (7-58) chipped in.

77.comment: Steven Jackson paced the group with 52 yards on 12 carries.

78.comment: Steven Jackson (11-46) did nothing outside of a 13-yard carry, while Jacquizz Rodgers (5-23) saw limited touches.

79.comment: Steven Jackson (14-54) and Antone Smith (4-50) in garbage time. Jackson wasn't great or anything, but he didn't look like a slow plodder in this game. The offensive line was most responsible for his production, however, as it blasted open massive holes for him versus a depleted defense. Meanwhile,

80.comment: Steven Jackson barely did anything with his opportunities (13 carries, 49 yards), while Antone Smith burst for a 48-yard touchdown at the end of the third quarter.

81.comment: Steven Jackson found some running room early - 8 carries, 36 yards and a touchdown in the first half - but the offensive line couldn't open up lanes in the second half either. Jackson finished with just 37 yards on 13 carries, though he did contribute in the passing game (5 catches, 37 rec. yards).

82.comment: Steven Jackson (6-25) were non-factors for Atlanta.    Cutler completed 26-of-38 for 381 yards with a touchdown and zero interceptions. Brandon Marshall had 6 receptions for 113 yards. Forte was excellent as usual with 17 carries for 80 yards and 2 scores on the ground with 10 receptions for 77 yards through the air.    Chicago's defense really stepped up with a big game. Allen, Young,

83.comment: Steven Jackson the ball, and the veteran running back once again wasted those downs. Jackson's 8 attempts went for just 22 yards, and he didn't have a gain longer than 4. What Smith should be doing is getting

84.comment: Steven Jackson ran like it was 2006, gaining 60 yards and a touchdown on 18 carries. Detroit couldn't stop Jackson on Atlanta's final drive, which is why it was curious why the Falcons even attempted a pass.    Detroit suffered a potential serious injury in this contest.

85.comment: Steven Jackson also found the end zone, and he actually ran very well for the first time all year, gaining 81 yards on 16 carries. Jackson's score came following 3 Tampa penalties. Two were sloppy offside infractions, but the third was a terrible pass interference that shouldn't have been called.    Meanwhile,

86.comment: Steven Jackson was completely ineffective. Jackson mustered just 41 yards on 17 carries, and he didn't have a gain longer than 5 yards. It seemed like a wasted down every single time Jackson touched the football, and it's very puzzling as to why

87.comment: Steven Jackson was going to be the 1 to break the streak. Jackson ran like it was 2006, gaining 101 yards on just 18 carries.

88.comment: Steven Jackson didn't get much on the ground. He gained 46 yards on 11 carries, but outside of 2 rushes, he didn't do very much.

89.comment: Steven Jackson didn't get much on the ground. He gained 46 yards on 11 carries, but outside of 2 rushes, he didn't do very much.

90.comment: Steven Jackson didn't get many touches because he left the game in the third quarter with a quad injury. The veteran back mustered only 9 yards on 4 carries.

91.comment: Steven Jackson saw some action, but was underwhelming; he was limited to 15 yards on 7 carries, albeit against a ferocious Jets run defense.

92.comment: Steven Jackson was the team's leading rusher, and he was very underwhelming, mustering only 35 yards and a touchdown on 14 attempts.
